briefTitle: Evaluation of Safety and Efficacy of Dapagliflozin in Subjects With Type 2 Diabetes Who Have Inadequate Glycaemic Control on Background Combination of Metformin and Sulfonylurea

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Type 2 diabetes mellitus
* Men or women age ≥ 18 years old
* Stable dose combination of metformin and sulfonylurea
* HbA1c ≥7.7% and ≤11.0%

Exclusion Criteria:

* Type 1 diabetes mellitus or diabetes insipidus
* Recent cardiovascular events
* Kidney or urological disorders
* Hepatic disorders

outcomeMeasures.title: Adjusted Mean Change From Baseline in HbA1c Levels
outcomeMeasures.description: To compare the change from baseline in HbA1c to week 24 between dapagliflozin 10 mg in combination with metformin and sulfonylurea and placebo in combination with metformin and sulfonylurea.

outcomeMeasures.title: Adjusted Mean Change From Baseline in FPG
outcomeMeasures.description: To compare the change from baseline in fasting plasma glucose (FPG) to week 24 (LOCF) between dapagliflozin and placebo

outcomeMeasures.title: Adjusted Mean Change From Baseline in Total Body Weight
outcomeMeasures.description: To compare the change from baseline in total body weight to week 24 (LOCF) between dapagliflozin and placebo

outcomeMeasures.title: Proportion of Participants With HbA1c Value < 7.0% at Week 24 (LOCF)
outcomeMeasures.description: To compare the proportion of subjects achieving a therapeutic glycemic response, defined as HbA1c \<7.0%, at week 24 (LOCF) between dapagliflozin and placebo

outcomeMeasures.title: Adjusted Mean Change From Baseline in Seated Systolic Blood Pressure
outcomeMeasures.description: To compare the change from baseline in seated systolic blood pressure (SBP) to week 8 (LOCF) between dapagliflozin and placebo
